results.definition: hang on during a trial of endurance
stay the same; remain in a certain state

examples: We are staying in Detroit; we are not moving to Cincinnati

results.definition: the state of inactivity following an interruption
examples: the momentary stay enabled him to escape the blow
You can stay with me while you are in town
stay a bit longer--the day is still young

results.definition: continue in a place, position, or situation
examples: After graduation, she stayed on in Cambridge as a student adviser
The smell stayed in the room

results.definition: a judicial order forbidding some action until an event occurs or the order is lifted
examples: the Supreme Court has the power to stay an injunction pending an appeal to the whole Court

results.definition: a thin strip of metal or bone that is used to stiffen a garment (e.g. a corset)
continuing or remaining in a place or state
examples: they had a nice stay in Paris
a four-month stay in bankruptcy court

results.definition: (nautical) brace consisting of a heavy rope or wire cable used as a support for a mast or spar

examples: The judge stayed the execution order
I had to stay at home and watch the children
